name: Costa Rica
partner: Andrés Bello Foundation – Latin American Chinese Research Center
takeaway: In several of the categories, Costa Rica's commitment to the People's Republic of China is evident. Some of the presentations at the national and subnational government level, as well as the political class, which benefits from travel, show the country's commitment to the People's Republic of China. Legislators, for example, look to China as a country with which they can continue to grow in economic terms.

Media appears to be a very important element. In the Media Domain, there are journalists who continue to benefit from training programs developed by China. Some media outlets use friendly language and reproduce information from PRC state media agencies.

The results support the widely held view that academia remains an important part of China and Chinese party-state entities. Scholarship programs, for example, that benefit students and professors are maintained.

In terms of technology, in 2023 there was a conflict between the two nations when the national government excluded China from its 5G service. However, there are several local governments that replicate China's surveillance system.

In terms of Economy, despite the fact that Costa Rica signed a Free Trade Agreement with China more than a decade ago, it is still a blurred mirror for the Central American country, i.e. it has not been successful. It will be interesting to explore the results to see if this has changed when the survey is conducted next time.
description-1: In 2023, Costa Rica had a GDP per capita of US$16,595 and a total population of 5.21 million people.
description-2: Costa Rica established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 2007. Costa Rica was ranked 26th in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 91/100.

Media.evidence: There is no evidence on the World Chinese Media network website (世界华文媒体). There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Media.note: Websites such as the one called Comunidad China de Costa Rica reproduce information from China Media Group, a media outlet that is part of the state-owned media of the People's Republic of China.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: The China Public Diplomacy Association (CPDA) together with the China-Latin America Press Center, within the framework of the China International Press Communication Center (CIPCC), extends invitations to journalists. Therefore, this indicator deserves a rating of "Few". Journalist Jason Ureña is one of the few who was in China between July and November 2023 participating in conferences. Therefore, this indicator deserves a rating of "Insignificant".
Media.note: In this indicator I resorted to an external source, in my country there is no publicity about these visits. I also confirm with publications of the journalist himself on his Instagram account and articles published in the newspaper where he works.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: At least two cases were found, that of a journalist and a local media columnist who attended invitations from the People's Republic of China. Therefore, this indicator deserves a rating of "Poor". It should be noted that there is very little information. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a rating of "Insignificant".
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: CGTN can be viewed on youtube in Spanish.  Therefore, this Indicator deserves a more than a few rating. Reports and commentary programs are broadcast. Therefore, this indicator deserves an significant rating
Media.note: Xinhua en Español (See here) is available online for any citizen to access the website, which also offers information from Costa Rica and China.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There are local initiatives such as Revista 168 | 哥国杂志168 a bilingual (Spanish and Chinese) social media outlet for the Chinese-speaking public residing in Costa Rica. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "few" rating. Activities related to the Belt and Road are promoted. Therefore, this indicator deserves an insignificant rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: Local media frequently use content provided by PRC state media. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “More than a few” rating. The phenomenon can be observed through the journalistic pieces they disseminate such as interviews or current affairs news. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an “Significant” rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “more than a few” rating. The People's Republic of China frequently offers scholarships for civil servants. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "yes" response.

Foreign Policy.evidence:
"Carlos Manuel Rodríguez, from Costa Rica, is a member of the CCICED Board. Therefore, this indicator deserves a yes response"". The Costa Rican national has served as Minister of Environment and Energy and was selected as Executive Director and Chairman of the Global Environment Facility in June 2020. Rodriguez is a pioneer in the development of Payment for Ecosystem Services and strategies for forest restoration, ocean conservation and decarbonization.

"

Foreign Policy.evidence:

Therefore, this indicator deserves a “yes” response.”

"

Academia.evidence: PinYin Fácil Mandarin Center Academy is endorsed by Costa Rican education authorities and the Chinese Ministry of Education. In 2022 it signed the "Chinese without Borders" agreement with local governments of Pococí, Guácimo and Siquirres, and the Chinese Embassy to grant scholarships to study Mandarin language in the province of Limón. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "yes" response.
Academia.note: As a background, in 2011 the project of a high school diploma in Mandarin originated with the advice of the Embassy of China and in 2016, the Ministry of Public Education (MEP) created the High Opportunity Schools Network Project to offer Mandarin as a third language in some schools.

Economy.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Economy.note: The United States remains Costa Rica's main trading partner, accounting for more than 40% of exports in 2022. Sales to the Chinese market are equivalent to 13.23%, according to data from the National Institute of Statistics and Census (INEC).
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: In the public debt statistics published in the website of the Ministry of Finance, there is an external debt component that reflects the bilateral debt of the central government and when analyzing it, it can be deduced that the debt related to the People's Republic of China is equivalent to 49% of Costa Rica's total bilateral debt. I want to emphasize that if we take into account the total external debt, China only represents 2.5%.  Therefore, this indicator deserves a "yes" response.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Economy.note: The oil extractive industry is outside Costa Rica's economic matrix. On the other hand, the Promotora de Comercio Exterior (Procomer) shows some gold exports, but none to China. The United States buys 100% of the raw gold.

Technology.evidence: Smart cities are on Costa Rica's radar. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a  "few” rating. The municipality of Nicoya signed in 2019 the National Program of Preventive Technology for Citizen Security with the state-owned company China National Electronics Import & Export Corporation (CEIEC) to provide cameras to the municipality in order to improve citizen security. Implementation is expected to take between 3 and 5 years. The cameras were installed in coordination with the security forces at strategic points in the municipality.  Therefore, this Indicator deserves an “Significant” rating.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Law Enforcement.note: The only extradition treaty was signed in 1990 with Taiwan and is no longer in force since the day Costa Rica reestablished diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China. And neither is mutual legal assistance.

Law Enforcement.evidence: In my country, due to the violence in which Costa Rica is immersed, there are public cases linked to Chinese mafias. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "yes" response.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: Although this article (See link 1) highlights the presence of a Chinese company in Costa Rica, there is no evidence to indicate this. The private security sector in Costa Rica has been out of control for several years and many companies operate informally. Therefore the Indicator cannot apply to this Index country.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: In my country, police and judicial training offered by individuals or entities related to the PRC has been accepted by the national government.  Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “Few” rating. There are precedents from institutions such as the Judiciary. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an “Significant” rating.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: In my country, there are reports of cyber-attacks targeting government, critical infrastructure or companies that were suspected to have come from the PRC. Therefore, this indicator deserves "yes" response.
Law Enforcement.note: The government of costa rica considers the Chinese government to be a higher risk government than a country that is not in the process of accession or has acceded to the Budapest Convention (See video link at minute 01:16:01).
